name: Dolmen Resort Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at a time share unit (Club Domen) for a week with limited cooking facilities. Our unit faced the water so it was a very nice few. It was quite noisy since the Amazonia club is right across the street from us as well as the bus depot was nearby. The hotel is quite dated, some water stains, and our unit had some malfunctioning equipment i.e. toaster & cooktop but since this is a timeshare unit - somethings you just can't really expect. It was nice that the cleaning staff came daily to take out your garbage, mop the floors, do the bed and change your towels. The location of the hotel is also safe and convenient walking to St. Paul's Bay. The bus depot is two blocks away and is convenient to catch buses to go sightseeing. We took buses to visit Mdina, Valleta, Temples Mnajdra and Hagar Qim. We also took the very to visit Gozo -- the bus station had an information office to help clarify which bus to take since most guidebooks do not provide the latest information given that the buses are very new. The Maltese people were very friendly.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay but very convenient location

reviews.text: The staff at the front desk aren't really helpful in the sense of providing concierge services so it's important to do some research beforehand.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We had an excellent time at the Dolmen. We took a family suite for 2 adults and 2 children and it was big and well laid out with a beautiful big balcony with a splendid view. Loved the pools and the area with ample parking for just 3 Euro regardless of time spent. Employees could smile a bit more at reception and breakfast but highly efficient. Breakfast sumptious and delicous.
reviews.title: We just loved it

reviews.text: Was a very relaxing beautiful holidauy. Excellent pool. Food varied. Lovely views.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, HIghly Recommend

reviews.text: We have just returned from a family holiday at The Dolmen. We booked our holiday all very last minute and we were expecting one of the unfurnished rooms that I have read about on here. However we were given a beautiful room, upgraded from a standard to a luxury room without even asking! Our only slight complaint was that we had one of the very few rooms that did not have a balcony. However the room was so lovely we did not want to change it as we were able to have windows open wide and sit in comfy chairs by the large window.
reviews.title: The Dolmen Hotel is a favourite destination with its excellent service and value for money.

reviews.text: Although I am Maltese, we have been the first time to the Dolmen...but surely its won't be the last. Everything was good beginning from the service, animation team, food, pools...etc.etc..I really recommend this hotel and I will surely go in the future.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel with several swimming pools and own and easy access to the sea. We are very pleased with the food at the hotel restaurants.

reviews.text: Just arrived back 9th August 2011. Lovely hotel, very pleasent staff. Food was good catering for all ages and nationalitys. The room on the 4th floor was very nice, if any negative point it would be the small balcony. Central location for shops bars and buses.
reviews.title: Good and bad

reviews.text: Yes we will be back.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location good for getting out and about, Food typical 3 star hotel food. Facilities good catering for all age groups. Only negative point really was the upgrade is not finished so you may get a sub standard room, like something from the 70's. Grubby, big box-like TV and no balcony. We got the seaview we had paid a supplement for but could only see it if you stood right in front of the 3'x3' window. We did eventually get a room change on the 3rd day, it felt like a different hotel from then on as our room had been refurbished, we had a balcony and it was located with the lift taking you near to the Reception and restaurant. We would go back but would make sure our room was decent before we accepted the key!!
reviews.title: plenty to do

reviews.text: What a disappointment! This is not a 4 star hotel. I would not recommend it to anyone! Accommodation, food and service all very poor.
reviews.title: What a disappointment! This is not a 4 star hotel. Not recommend.

reviews.text: On arrival allocated two rooms on 3rd floor. Reception informed immediately that the rooms were unacceptable and rejected both. Told nothing else available until the following day.
reviews.title: Jekyll and Hyde hotel - summary

reviews.text: In the first room the toilet flush panel came off the wall upon first use and using the sink flooded the bathroom floor.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: In the second room the wardrobe door fell off when first used and only just missed one of the children standing nearby. The room was exceptionally hot and the air con did not work.
reviews.title: Love it we'll be back next year

reviews.text: I have never left a bad review in over 50 hotels but I seriously fell a 4* rating is way over the top for this hotel!!!! I have never had a negative thing to say about a hotel until I visited the Dolmen, if you have not already booked, I would not advise it.
reviews.title: Honest review.. and warning!!! PLEASE READ it will help!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went with my husband and my parents. We arrived and the reception staff (particularly the two women who wore their hair in buns) were rude and miserable, I thought I had entered a funeral parlour not a hotel. I was given room 289 and my parents were given 296.. we walked through what looked like refurbished rooms as had nice doors and a carpet and then we kept on walking and saw mould on the walls and no carpet and what looked like a cheap B&B.. we got to my parents room first and were gobsmacked at how small the room was, it stank and had a sewage problem, the room was the smallest I had ever seen and I go on holiday at least two times a year. ME and my husband went to our room and we had NO BALCONY only a tiny window (which did not open) I was gagging at how bad the room smelt, seriously smelt like sewage aswell. The room was awful, I went on an 18-30's holiday at a 2 star ibiza hotel and that room was better than this. Needless to say me and my mother went to complain at reception, the reception staff said they are fully booked and we would have to stay in the rooms tonight, they admitted their was a sewage problem in that block but as fully booked nothing we can do. THEY WERE SO RUDE! My mother began to cry and the lady at reception started shouting at me "You tell me what I can do" I started shouting back and other guests were arriving. In the end the guest relations manager came out, half an hour of arguing that they could not locate us any other rooms and the manager said she would put us in the apartment near by and allocate us both different rooms in the morning. We had to live in our suitcases all day and were told by a male receptionist to come back at 10am the next morning. 10am we went to reception and the female said actually we need to come back at 2pm. I told her that we were told by her colleague to come back at 10am not 2pm! She said that was incorrect, no apology, nothing. So rude!! We finally at 2pm (after living out of suitcases further) were both located apparently the best rooms in the hotel. I would rate our new rooms, 511 and 507 as average and possibly at a push 3* rooms. Hair drier was broke, toilet didnt flush, but we got the toilet working from the maintence team. On a positive the swimming pools were lovely and the animation team were absoultely fantastic... they were way too good to be working in a hotel like the Dolmen! Fantastic animation team. They only did an evening show twice a week the rest of the week there was no entertainment which was a bit boring but the best thing about the hotel were the animation team and the pools. The beach pools were nice... Now the food. Awful.Boring....terrible!! Every evening was similar, harldy any salad and I love salad abroad.. their was meat in every single dish and if you are a vegetarian all you can eat is pasta... No english food to fall back on, no pizza, chips, no ice cream, no food for kids, no ice cream they put on a rum cake one night, dosed in alchol and were allowing kids to have it, I spoke to one lady who was hysterical as her daughter was 6 and on antibiotics and had the cake and was very poorly.. never found out what happened about it though.The restaurant staff would rather stand around talking than clean our plates, we ended up taking our plates to them every night. I thought for a 4* restaurant they could at least pour our drinks but they plonked them on the table. ALSO... they served gorgeous soup but only had 20 soup spoons for the whole hotel... we asked for soup spoons and were told they only had around 20 and we were given a large serving spoon. In the end we all ate our soup with a tea spoon every night. The Spa was fantastic I had massages every other day. Definately recommend that!! If you are put in the rooms which are as awful as ours were I seriously suggest you complain but I would not recommend this hotel based on the hassle we had with the rooms and the poor food. Casino was good fun!
reviews.title: First time-great choice

reviews.text: We spent five days here,after a very selective search through the usual travel outlets,and were hugely impressed by the hotel and its staff.
reviews.title: Excellent for a family relaxation period!

reviews.title: Definitely not a 4* possibly a poor 3*

description: Beautiful located at the waters edge, the 4 star hotel boasts 375 guest rooms and 38 highly finished superior rooms and suites with panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea and St. Paul’s Islands. All bedrooms and suites are fully air-conditioned, centrally, heated and have their own private bathroom, safe deposit box, satellite TV, direct dial telephone, radio, mini-bar and hair dryers. The majority of the rooms have a balcony or terrace.The hotel’s general facilities include a Conferece Centre, Casino, an A La Carte Restaurant, Buffet Restaurant, Piano Cocktails Bar, Wine Bar, Cafeteria, Swim-Up Bar, Night Club and Caribbean Style Beach Club offering a variety of water-sports, a Diving Centre, Bars and Restaurant.Four outdoor swimming pools are located within the hotel together with one dedicated for children. The newly designed Spa incorporates state of the art Therapy rooms with the latest equipment as well as a Fitness Room, Indoor Pool with hydro massage and sauna. Within the hotel’s garden two tennis courts are available.Animation Activities are provided on a daily basis together with a kids club during the summer months. A regular entertainment is held during the evenings.
